summary: This document is a letter from the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) confirming the tax-exempt status of the J Epstein Virgin Islands Foundation Inc. It outlines the foundation's obligations under the Internal Revenue Code, including requirements for filing tax returns and maintaining records to ensure compliance with tax-exempt purposes.

persons.name: J Epstein
persons.context: J Epstein is identified as the applicant for the tax-exempt status of the Virgin Islands Foundation.

keyFacts: The J Epstein Virgin Islands Foundation Inc. is recognized as a private foundation exempt from federal income tax under section 501(c)(3).
The foundation must file Form 990-PF annually and is subject to excise taxes under chapter 42 of the Internal Revenue Code.
Donors can deduct contributions to the foundation under certain conditions outlined in the Internal Revenue Code.
The foundation is required to maintain records to ensure funds are used for tax-exempt purposes.
The letter emphasizes the importance of notifying the IRS of any changes in operations or organizational documents.
